result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

No travel outside the state without prior court approval.

9:16 AM Defendant JAMES W. LYONS JR. in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Laura Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over Defendant's right to an attorney. Defendant waives right to an attorney. Court accepts waiver of attorney. Court reads information to Defendant. Defendant enters NG pleas. Defendant presents bond mod. State objects. Remarks by Defendant. Court grants $1500 signature bond with all prior conditions as set.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on December 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:26 PM Defendant JAMES W. LYONS JR. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Laura Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant qualifies for public defender services, but counsel has not been appointed yet. Defendant wishes to waive his right to counsel and proceed with the preliminary hearing today.  Defendant waives personal appearance and appears remotely.  Court advises party of his right to counsel and accepts waiver of counsel for today only.  Deputy R. Ambrosius is sworn in by the Court and questioned by Atty. Nelson.  Witness identifies the defendant.  Bail bond identified by witness.  Arguments.  Court makes its findings, finds probable cause and binds over.  Defendant wishes to represent himself at further proceedings.  Defendant to appear in person at next court date.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No travel outside the state without prior court approval.
